pullRequest.body:
A family of continuous maps `f : α → C(β, γ)` is continuous on an open set if it is pointwise continuous, provided that `β` is compact and `α` is locally compact. 

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Deletions:

### PR summary [20865af3c3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15632/commits/20865af3c3b6c9111fcddca125fa8601e5790d41)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ continuousOn_of_pointwise_continuousOn_of_compact`
`+ continuousOn_of_pointwise_continuousOn_of_compact'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
`ContinuousMap.curry` says that you don't need any assumptions on the topologies or on the set `U`.

> `ContinuousMap.curry` says that you don't need any assumptions on the topologies or on the set `U`.

I was not aware of  `ContinuousMap.curry`; I'll just close this PR now since I can just use that instead of this lemma.
Is it true for topological spaces?
I don't know. If it is I have no idea how to prove it.
It is not important that `α` be a uniform space, because it the continuity is only used locally, and it is locally compact, and compact spaces have a canonical uniform structure.

pullRequest.title: feat(ContinuousMap): A family `f : α → C(β, γ)` is continuous if it is pointwise continuous and `β` is compact
